H0.text: Less waste is one problem when robots are used to help manufacture cars.

H1.text: Lower cost is one problem with using robots to help manufacture cars.

H2.text: Fewer jobs are the problem that arises when robots are used to help manufacture cars.

H3.text: More mistakes are a problem when robots are used to help manufacture cars.

A4.text: worker displacement due to systemic loss of employment

A5.text: Faster production without human intervention can mean faster unchecked production of defects where automated processes are defective

A6.text: Rapid advances in automation technologies (e.g. fixed robots, collaborative and mobile robots, and exoskeletons) have the potential to improve work conditions but also to introduce workplace hazards in manufacturing workplaces.

A7.text: Injuries and fatalities could increase over time because of the increasing number of collaborative and co-existing robots, powered exoskeletons, and autonomous vehicles into the work environment.
